intro: Argyreia tomentosa, commonly known as the velvet flower or Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is characterized by its large, showy, velvety purple or pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has heart-shaped, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight. Argyreia tomentosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
